III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
An on-site inspection was completed on 8/3/2010, at which time this consultant did a
walk-through of the facility. The facility is located at 21802 Clark in Belleville on a dirt
road 7 miles south of I-94 and 3 miles west of I-275.
The facility is a large ranch-style single-family home with a double wide driveway.
There is a shed, but no garage. From the driveway, a wooden deck with handrails
leads to the side entrance of the house. Upon entering the side door, there is a laundry
room with a freezer, washer, dryer, and two closets that house the furnace and water
heater. Cleaning products are stored in locked wall cabinets. The home is equipped
with central air conditioning, which was broken and being repaired at the time of the
inspection.
To the right of the laundry room is a bathroom that connects to the first resident
bedroom. The bedroom has a twin bed, crib, dresser and closet. The staff office is
2

located around the corner. Both rooms are off of the den. The staff office has a desk,
chair, file cabinets, locked medication bins, and policy books. It will also have a printer,
fax machine, copier and a staff computer with a second computer to be purchased for
use by the residents.
The den has a non-functioning fireplace and is furnished with an armless couch,
children’s stools, chairs and a children’s art easel. The den leads to a large kitchen with
large counter space and numerous floor and wall cabinets. There is stove, large
refrigerator/freezer, and a small refrigerator used to store infant milk and formula. Both
units are equipped with thermometers set at the appropriate temperatures.
Off of the kitchen are the second and third bedrooms painted bright pink and blue. The
bedrooms have an adjoining bathroom. Continuing through the kitchen is a large dining
room furnished with a dining table, six chairs and three high chairs. Behind the dining
area is a door wall that leads to a large wooden deck, overlooking the backyard. The
deck spans the length of the house. The deck has a built-in ceiling fan and large swing
for resident seating. The backyard is large and surrounded by a six-foot tall wooden
privacy fence.
Through a small hallway off of the dining room is the fourth bedroom which is painted
brown and contains a twin bed, crib, dresser and closet. Then a large fifth bedroom
painted light pink contains two twin beds, two cribs, two dressers and two closets.
There is a third bathroom with a toilet, single shower, large bathtub and double sinks.
A doorway off of the kitchen opens up to the front living area. This room has a picture
window and ceiling fan, furnished with a couch. A wooden ramp is built at the front of
the home and is wheelchair accessible.
B. Program Description
Sumpter House provides comprehensive residential and therapeutic services for
adolescent females ages 13 -18 with one child between the ages of 0 – 3 years who are
in need of a small community-based setting that addresses parenting issues.
The focus of treatment will be to help the teenage mother with a young child move
toward self-sufficiency and independence, by learning how to access community
programs that enable them to properly care for their child, complete their education,
locate quality subsidized day care, and provide support geared at stabilizing their life
through short- and long-term planning.
Services offered include case management, skill assessment, treatment planning,
individual or group therapy, education, vocational/employment assistance, independent
living skills training, community resource development, child development training,
workshops/seminars, parenting classes, infant CPR/First Aid training, nutrition
education, WIC appointments, mentoring and 24-hr availability.
3

Referrals are accepted from the Michigan Department of Humans Services and Care
Management Organizations.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
This facility is in full compliance with the Michigan licensing rules for Child Caring
Institutions.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend this facility be issued an Original Provisional License.
